answers.answer: You didn't do anything hun,its just how our bodies react to being pregnant,everyone is different,just be thankful that caught it now instead of later. Youll be just fine. Head up.

It just appears. There's nothing you could have done differently. 36 weeks isn't that early and it's safest for both of you. Try not to worry they found it early so I'm surrounding everything will be ok :))

hey dont worry.. you did everything right.. its not your fault :)... i m thinking that i probably going to get gestational diabetes test again because of his growth.. if that came back positive then i ll be induce early too.. although i have passed 2hrs one before... so dont worry ok.. just Hope for best :)... you ll be holding your son early :)
what is preclampsia?
You didn't do anything wrong girl, my sister in law had preclampsia with her first but not her second..sometimes it just happens. Sorry you're going through this though :(
I'm sorry hun, it just happens sometimes. Just try not to stress too much and do what doc tells you too and you should be fine
Preeclampsia isnt ur fault. There wasnt anything u culd of done to prevent it. ! So dont think like that! Goodluck girl!
ull be ok:)
The doctor just made me feel horrible. The only good thing that came out of today is that they told me that I've passed my glucose test for the 4th damn time.
4th time? :O
Yeah, they like to test me a lot.lol
c there is always a positive! u cant control preclasmpsia doctors do that all the time mine made me feel like **** about my weight to

Yeah, I have a feeling they were trying to say my weight caused it, but the nurse actually came in and said it was uncontrollable. It kind of made me feel better. At least I get to see my baby more, that's a positive :)

I had preeclampsia with both of my prior pregnancies. I seemed to be fine with both up until I hit 32 weeks. That's when the problem started. Pregnancy is rough on your body and everyone's body reacts differently. There is nothing you did to bring it on. Just try to eat healthy and be sure to give your body enough rest. I was induced with both and it's really not so bad. My first I was induced at 35 weeks and my 2nd at 37 weeks. Both of my girls are healthy and never had any issues at all because they were early. I am now pregnant with my 3rd, only 6 weeks along, but have it in the back of my mind that it will happen again. I am just trying to eat healthy and get exercise on a regular basis. I have my fingers crossed it won't happen again but I won't be surprised if it does. Good luck to you. Just try not to stress yourself out because that is no good for your mental or physical health. Have faith that everything will be fine.
Aww wow don't ever think its your fault it never was.

what were your babies weights? did they have to stay in the NICU for any amount of time? if you breastfed, did they have a problem latching on because they were a month early? sorry for so many questions, I'm just scared. Most of my family members go over 40 weeks with their babies, so I'm afraid about having my baby so early.

Don't let your doctor make you feel bad about it! That's horrible if they do. My mom has 3 children. She had it only with one of my brothers and he came out healthy as can be with no issues. That was 23 years ago and technology is far more advanced now so don't worry, everything will be fine! :)
Thanks!

Acline, I am very overweight and do not have pre eclampsia, I do however have gestational hypertensia which is closely related to PE, as you probably know they are delivering my little guy at 37 weeks. You did NOTHING to cause this. It is completely uncontrollable, skinny people get it too, just being.overweight cab factor.into it, the same way it can factor into gestational diabetes, which theyve tested mefor several times as well, even though theyre negative in my blood work. Don't get upset, just try and relax, and trust your doctors, they are gonna take good care of you, and would not induce or deliver early if they thought the cons outweighed the pros. Cheer up love!
aww thanks shelleversole! How far along are you?

Hang in there, take it easy and dont stress yourself out. My mom had it 9 yesrs ago when she was pregnant with my sister  and she was really overweight. Mt sister was born a month early weighed 5 lbs and was very healthy. She did not have to stay in NICU and was perfectly fine on her own :) pray for you that the rest of your pregnancy goes smoothly and you have a healthy happy baby!

35+6 being delivered at exactky 37 weeks ob the 25th just had a growth ultrasoubd today, they said he looks to be 5lb 6oz atm, but those measurements can go a pound both ways. I have an ultrasound once/week, a non stress test 1/week and my prenatal appt weekly haha it actually makes me feel better to know theyre watching him so close!

Hey I know how you feel they told me I might have it I go to a neo natal doctor 2 times a week and my ob doctor once a week. I was stuck in the hospital for about a week it sucked now Im on bed rest .. They told me they want to deliever at 28~32 weeks.. I felt the same way IM scared to go to the doctor only good thing is I get to see my Lil girl twice a week on u/s I cryed all the time but I kept telling myself I can stress out BC it's not good it's better said then done IM sorry I hope it gets better im26 weeks now
How much weight did you gain i had it they induced me at 38 dont eat nothing salty nothing
I was 125 went to 160

Youve done nothing wrong! :/ It's a temporary condition, with all the changes your body goes through in pregnancy their is always so many risks to moms and baby...Just do the best you can, your more than halfway there and cool thing to look forward to is you get to see ur baby often and sooner than you thought! Try to not worry :)
@love my kids- I've lost 30, and have gained back 8...so all in all I've lost 22 pounds but I'm retaining fluid.

There's a quote that says "Don't tell God how big your storm is, Tell your storm how big YOUR GOD is". So if he brings you to it , he will bring you through it Acline. Just follow Drs orders and don't lose faith and you and your baby will be just fine... :)

Nothing you could have change dear. It's awesome they caught is to quickly though. Try to stay positive and just think you know for sure how many days until you get to birth your little man! I would make a paper chain for the days lol.
Thanks! Now we have to figure out a new baby shower date and everything. It's so stressful!
Whats preeclampsia? Ive heard of it before but cant remember. Sorry about what you have to go through acline *hugs*
I had preelcampsia wiv 1st baby n all the signs wiv 2nd i gt induced 37 wks n they weighd 7lb 6 and 7lb14

it's high blood pressure(consistently) in pregnancy with fluid retention and additional protein in your urine. They told me it was dangerous to carry preeclampsia patients to full term, so they usually induce around 36 or 37 weeks so I have to get the ultrasounds done and based on his size, they'll decide when to induce me.
oh wow, those aren't bad weights! were you able to breast feed since they were a little early? I'm worried because I've heard that sometimes a baby won't latch if he is too early :(

I had preeclampsia with my first. She was born 4 lb 11 oz. at 35 weeks. No serious health  problems. She did have to stay in Nicu for a week because of jaundice but she breast fed just fine. She's 5 on valentines day and super smart. Just stay positive!
Aww okay, I'm getting reassured! Thanks!

oh man im sorry to hear that! dont worry ull be just fine.. my friend weighs about 115 prepregnancy  and she had that PLUS anemia PLUS gestional diabetes and she delivered her babies just fine! ur lucky u only have that! i wish u the best luck

question: :( I'm at the OB, and I did not get good news. They told me that I have preeclampsia and that I will have to get an ultrasound done every 1-2 weeks and they'll most likely try to induce me at 36 weeks. I feel like a failure as a mom. :( like seriously, wtf did I do wrong?
title: preeclampsia
